meanings.definition: The property exhibited by certain crystals of becoming electrically polarized when subjected to a mechanical stress or an electric field.
meanings.sent1: Ferroelectricity in crystals shows how they can change their electric charge when squeezed or zapped.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study ferroelectricity in crystals to understand how they react to different forces.
meanings.sent3: The crystal's ferroelectricity made it the life of the party, changing its charge with every dance move.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like ferroelectricity, building up until it sparked into a bright idea.
meanings.sent5: The concept of ferroelectricity is like a dance between positive and negative charges in crystals.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of ferroelectric materials exhibiting spontaneous electric polarization that can be reversed by an external electric field.
meanings.sent1: Understanding ferroelectricity helps in creating materials that can switch their charge with ease.
meanings.sent2: The discovery of ferroelectricity in materials opened up new possibilities for technology.
meanings.sent3: The ferroelectricity in the material seemed to have a mind of its own, flipping its charge unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like ferroelectricity, always ready to reverse any negative situation.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of ferroelectricity lies in its ability to switch polarities like a magic trick.
